summary: A return-value statement causes execution to immediately exit the invocation of a function.
details: A return-value statement cannot be used in a function whose return-type is void.
The value will be boxed, if necessary.
The value will be unboxed, if necessary.
The value will be coerced, if necessary.
static-checks: The type of the value must be either a primitive-type or a reference-type.
The type of the value must be assignable to the return-type of the enclosing function.
example-1: module Main in program;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    val x = My::cube(1);%0A    val y = My::cube(2);%0A    val z = My::cube(3);%0A%0A    F::println(x);%0A    F::println(y);%0A    F::println(z);%0A}%0A%0Adefun cube (n : int) : int%0A{%0A    return n * n * n; %0A}
